required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Triprilimab(JS001) and Chemotherapy Combined With Local Treatment for Multiple Metastatic NPC
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open Multicenter Phase II Clinical Study of Triprilimab(JS001) and Chemotherapy Combined With Local Treatment for Multiple Metastatic NPC

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized, phase II, prospective, multicenter clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of JS001 and chemotherapy combined with local treatment in patients with multiple metastatic nasopharyngeal carcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from diagnosis of metastasis to first documented disease progression (PD) using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. For target lesions, PD was defined as at least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum of the longest diameter recorded since treatment started or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions. For non-target lesions, PD was defined as the appearance of 1 or more new lesions and/or unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions.

arm_group.description: Patients with multiple metastatic NPC were given Triprilimab(JS001) and chemotherapy combined with local treatment.

facility.name: Department of radiation oncology, Fujian cancer hospital
